title: Projects
text:
A working collection of bioinformatics problem sets, genomic data analysis, and development projects — built while working toward computational biology research and data science applications.
All projects are version-controlled and documented on GitHub.

title: Projects
text:
Rosalind Problem Sets
Algorithm implementations in Python and R for problems from Rosalind.info — covering string algorithms, sequence analysis, graph theory, and molecular biology fundamentals.

title: About Me
text:
My Journey
My interest in bioinformatics emerged from a fascination with how computational approaches can decode biological complexity. With a foundation in biomedical sciences and genomics, I’m now focused on building strong programming and data analysis skills to bridge wet-lab biology and computational research.
I’m working through bioinformatics problem sets, building analysis pipelines, and documenting my learning journey through this portfolio. My background includes teaching experience in gymnastics and education, which has strengthened my ability to break down complex concepts and communicate effectively.

title: About Me
text:
Technical Skills
Programming Languages - Python (primary focus for bioinformatics) - R (statistical analysis and visualization) - Bash/Shell scripting - SQL for database querying
Bioinformatics Tools & Platforms - Git/GitHub for version control - Linux/WSL development environment - Quarto for reproducible research - Data analysis libraries (pandas, NumPy, BioPython)
Computational Biology - Sequence analysis algorithms - Statistical methods for genomics - Data visualization - Pipeline development

title: About Me
text:
Interests Beyond Science


Scuba Diving
Open-water and nitrox certified. Diving demands methodical preparation, situational awareness, and staying calm under pressure — skills that translate directly to research and problem solving.


Martial Arts
Black belt in Taekwondo, with training in Muay Thai and Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu. Martial arts taught me that mastery is a process, not a destination — a philosophy I carry into learning bioinformatics.


Yu-Gi-Oh
Competitive player focused on deck building and strategic play. The game demands pattern recognition, probabilistic thinking, and adapting under pressure.


Writing
Currently writing Useless Man: Embracing the Exiled Self — a philosophical exploration of identity, purpose, and the freedom found in not fitting the expected mold.

title: About Me
text:
What’s Next
I’m actively seeking opportunities in bioinformatics, computational biology, or data science where I can apply my growing technical skills and contribute to meaningful research. I’m particularly interested in genomics, algorithm development, and data-driven biological discovery.
Open to: Full-time positions, internships, collaborations, and freelance projects Download Resume Download CV

title: Research
text: Undergraduate and graduate research grounded in genomics and computational biology. My work focuses on applying quantitative methods to biological questions — connecting wet-lab context with data-driven analysis.

title: Research
text:
Research Interests
My primary interests are in computational genomics — particularly sequence analysis, variant interpretation, and building reproducible pipelines for high-throughput biological data. I’m drawn to work that sits at the intersection of algorithmic problem-solving and biological discovery, and I’m actively developing the computational foundation to contribute to that kind of research.
View Projects → Contact Me
